definition: to be penniless
(negative prefix)/not/no
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: This idiom is a metaphor of be penniless in extreme poverty.
sentences.chinese: 不名一钱这则成语是比喻极度贫穷。

definition: total illiterate/unable to read the simplest characters
with money, you can do anything (idiom)/money talks
stingy/penny-pinching
to not even take a penny (as a bribe)
not even enough land to stand an awl (idiom); absolutely destitute
to be avaricious and mean
lit. to use a sacred tripod as cooking pot and jade as ordinary stone (idiom); fig. a waste of precious material/casting pearls before swine
every drop returns to the public good (idiom); not one penny is misused
to allow oneself few comforts or pleasures (idiom)
begging for pity and asking for help (idiom)
lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands/uncorrupted/unsoiled by corrupt practices
to take sth without permission
to make endless exorbitant demands
to dismiss from office/to expel
to use influence to get what one wants/to find a way through (esp. corrupt)/to succeed by means fair or foul
to possess nothing except bare necessities/to live a poor or frugal life
